trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers located on on-premises to Azure or to a secondary on-premises site.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers located on on-premises to Azure or to a secondary on-premises site.

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.

trans-unit.source: Read about possible deployment scenarios in the [Site Recovery Overview](site-recovery-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: Read about possible deployment scenarios in the [Site Recovery Overview](site-recovery-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Storage mapping is an important element of your Site Recovery deployment.
trans-unit.target: Storage mapping is an important element of your Site Recovery deployment.

trans-unit.source: It ensures your making optimal use of storage.
trans-unit.target: It ensures your making optimal use of storage.

trans-unit.source: This article describes storage mapping and provides a couple of examples to help you understand how storage mapping works.
trans-unit.target: This article describes storage mapping and provides a couple of examples to help you understand how storage mapping works.

trans-unit.source: Post any questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/azure/home?forum=hypervrecovmgr).
trans-unit.target: Post any questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/azure/home?forum=hypervrecovmgr).

trans-unit.source: The way in which you set up storage mapping depends on your Site Recovery deployment scenario.
trans-unit.target: The way in which you set up storage mapping depends on your Site Recovery deployment scenario.

trans-unit.source: **On-premises to on-premises (replicate with Hyper-V Replica)**—Map storage classifications on a source and target VMM servers to do the following:
trans-unit.target: **On-premises to on-premises (replicate with Hyper-V Replica)**—Map storage classifications on a source and target VMM servers to do the following:

trans-unit.source: **Identify target storage for replica virtual machines**—Virtual machines will be replicated to a storage target (SMB share or cluster shared volumes (CSVs)) that you choose.
trans-unit.target: **Identify target storage for replica virtual machines**—Virtual machines will be replicated to a storage target (SMB share or cluster shared volumes (CSVs)) that you choose.

trans-unit.source: **Replica virtual machine placement**—Storage mapping is used to optimally place replica virtual machines on Hyper-V host servers.
trans-unit.target: **Replica virtual machine placement**—Storage mapping is used to optimally place replica virtual machines on Hyper-V host servers.

trans-unit.source: Replica virtual machines will be placed on hosts that can access the mapped storage classification.
trans-unit.target: Replica virtual machines will be placed on hosts that can access the mapped storage classification.

trans-unit.source: **No storage mapping**—If you don’t configure storage mapping virtual machines will be replicated to the default storage location specified on the Hyper-V host server associated with the replica virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: **No storage mapping**—If you don’t configure storage mapping virtual machines will be replicated to the default storage location specified on the Hyper-V host server associated with the replica virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: **On-premises to on-premises (replicate with SAN)**—Maps storage arrays pools on a source and target VMM servers to do the following:
trans-unit.target: **On-premises to on-premises (replicate with SAN)**—Maps storage arrays pools on a source and target VMM servers to do the following:

trans-unit.source: **Identify target storage pools**—Storage mapping ensures that LUNs in a replication group are replicated the mapped target storage pool.
trans-unit.target: **Identify target storage pools**—Storage mapping ensures that LUNs in a replication group are replicated the mapped target storage pool.

trans-unit.source: You map between storage classifications on source and target VMM servers, or on a single VMM server if two sites are managed by the same VMM server.
trans-unit.target: You map between storage classifications on source and target VMM servers, or on a single VMM server if two sites are managed by the same VMM server.

trans-unit.source: When mapping is configured correctly and replication is enabled, a virtual machine’s virtual hard disk at the primary location will be replicated to storage in mapped target location.
trans-unit.target: When mapping is configured correctly and replication is enabled, a virtual machine’s virtual hard disk at the primary location will be replicated to storage in mapped target location.

trans-unit.source: Storage classifications must be available to the host groups located in source and target clouds
trans-unit.target: Storage classifications must be available to the host groups located in source and target clouds

trans-unit.source: Classifications don’t need to have the same type of storage.
trans-unit.target: Classifications don’t need to have the same type of storage.

trans-unit.source: For example you can map a source classification that contains SMB shares to a target classification that contains CSVs
trans-unit.target: For example you can map a source classification that contains SMB shares to a target classification that contains CSVs

trans-unit.source: Read more in [How to create storage classifications in VMM](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/gg610685.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Read more in [How to create storage classifications in VMM](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/gg610685.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If classifications are configured correctly in VMM when you select the source and target VMM server during storage mapping, the source and target classifications will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: If classifications are configured correctly in VMM when you select the source and target VMM server during storage mapping, the source and target classifications will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example of storage files shares and classifications for an organization with two locations in New York and Chicago.
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example of storage files shares and classifications for an organization with two locations in New York and Chicago.

trans-unit.source: You'd configure these on the **Server Storage** tab in the **Resources** page of the Site Recovery portal.
trans-unit.target: You'd configure these on the **Server Storage** tab in the **Resources** page of the Site Recovery portal.

trans-unit.source: When a a replica virtual machine is created for any virtual machine on GOLD storage (SourceShare1), it will be replicated to a GOLD_TARGET storage (TargetShare1).
trans-unit.target: When a a replica virtual machine is created for any virtual machine on GOLD storage (SourceShare1), it will be replicated to a GOLD_TARGET storage (TargetShare1).

trans-unit.source: When a replica virtual machine is created for any virtual machine on SILVER storage (SourceShare2), it will be replicated to a SILVER_TARGET (TargetShare2) storage, and so on.
trans-unit.target: When a replica virtual machine is created for any virtual machine on SILVER storage (SourceShare2), it will be replicated to a SILVER_TARGET (TargetShare2) storage, and so on.

trans-unit.source: The actual file shares and their assigned classifications in VMM would be as shown below.
trans-unit.target: The actual file shares and their assigned classifications in VMM would be as shown below.

trans-unit.source: If the target classification is assigned to multiple SMB shares or CSVs the optimal storage location will be selected automatically when the virtual machine is protected.
trans-unit.target: If the target classification is assigned to multiple SMB shares or CSVs the optimal storage location will be selected automatically when the virtual machine is protected.

trans-unit.source: If no suitable target storage is available with the specified classification, the default storage location specified on the Hyper-V host is used to place the replica virtual hard disks.
trans-unit.target: If no suitable target storage is available with the specified classification, the default storage location specified on the Hyper-V host is used to place the replica virtual hard disks.

trans-unit.source: The following table show how storage classification and cluster shared volumes are set up in our example.
trans-unit.target: The following table show how storage classification and cluster shared volumes are set up in our example.

trans-unit.source: This table summarizes the behavior when you enable protection for virtual machines (VM1 - VM5) in this example environment.
trans-unit.target: This table summarizes the behavior when you enable protection for virtual machines (VM1 - VM5) in this example environment.

trans-unit.source: No mapping so default storage location of the Hyper-V host is used
trans-unit.target: No mapping so default storage location of the Hyper-V host is used

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a better understanding of storage mapping start reading the [best practices](site-recovery-best-practices.md) to prepare for deployment.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a better understanding of storage mapping start reading the [best practices](site-recovery-best-practices.md) to prepare for deployment.
